item.title: About Hanna
item.description: .column-left{ float: left; width: 33%; text-align: left; } .column-center{ display: inline-block; width: 33%; text-align: center; } .column-right{ float: left; width: 45%; text-align: left; } Background: Born and raised in the frozen suburbs of Minneapolis Minnesota, I fled to Florida in 2013 to study Statistics at the University of Central Florida (Go Knights!). I discovered that research is really important and medicine is a fascinating field, so at some point I decided I should try to become an expert in Biostatistics.

item.title: Rob Stewart is my hero.
item.description: Growing up in a land-locked area, I had little exposure to the ocean and the creatures that call it home. So it was a bit unusual that I developed a deep-seeded love for the predator of the seas - sharks. The moment I looked past their media-driven reputation as ruthless killers, I discovered their worth. Having evolved over 400 million years ago, and surviving the last five mass extinctions, itâ€™s no wonder these animals are amazing super-predators, shaping all oceanic life and ecosystems since their arrival.
